channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Regions - Americas
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2016 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Diyab went on hunger strike for 68 days to resettle closer to his family
USA soccer star signs for European champion
item.description: The World Cup champion and Olympic gold medal winner has left the Orlando Pride to sign for reigning European champion Olympique Lyon.

item.title: US Coast Guard seizes 26.5 tons of cocaine
Brazil: Protests erupt over austerity
Uproar in Chile over sex doll joke gift
item.description: A sex doll has landed a government minister and an export executive in hot water in Chile.

item.title: Colombian Pres accepts prize for deal with FARC
Venezuela's 'Grinch' seizes 5M toys
item.description: Venezuelan officials have confiscated nearly 5 million toys from a toy distributor, accusing the company of planning to sell them at inflated prices during the Christmas season.

item.title: 3 generations under 'El Comandante'
Neymar creates his 'ultimate player'
item.description: CNN asked Barcelona star Neymar which former and current world stars he would combine to create his "ultimate football player."

item.title: Cuba: What's next under Raul Castro?
item.description: Now that his brother Fidel is no longer looking over his shoulder, will Cuba President Raul Castro take the chance to move their country in a new direction?

item.title: Miami schools: Immigration rise after Castro death?
item.description: While leaders in Cuba make preparations for Fidel Castro's funeral, one top official in Miami says he's preparing for another possibility: increased immigration.

item.title: What you need to know about Zika
item.description: The mosquito-borne Zika virus is spreading around the globe. Researchers are learning new information about the virus every day. Here is the latest news and research.

item.title: Elian Gonzalez: Castro as a father figure
item.description: Elian Gonzalez, who was at the center of a controversial international custody dispute when he was a boy, saw the late Fidel Castro as a father figure.

item.title: Breakdancing heads to Olympics
item.description: Breakdancing is moving from the streets to the Olympics.

item.title: Nicaraguan Pres. seeks third term in a row?
'Mummers' make a comeback?
Bolivia: The 'fighting cholitas'
Cuba's window into baseball?
item.description: On a sun-beaten suburban ballpark in Havana, young Little Leaguers line up to bat in front of a chain-link backstop missing its chain-links.

item.title: A new breed of driverless vehicles?
item.description: Imagine a super-fast, driverless motorbike flying across highways 24/7, issuing traffic tickets -- via mobile apps -- to the owners of any vehicle daring to break the speed limit.

item.title: 10 dishes to try in Argentina
CNN en Español
item.description: Habla español? Visit CNN en Español for all the latest news and updates in Spanish.

item.title: Protesters storm Venezuela's assembly
item.description: Violence erupts during a special meeting of the Venezuelan National Assembly. CNN's Rafael Romo reports.

item.title: Experts claim they've solved Bermuda Triangle mystery
item.description: A Science Channel found hexagon-shaped "air bombs" over the Bermuda Triangle. The report suggests "air bombs" are capable of bringing down planes and ships.

item.title: Cuba's Zika battle
item.description: Cuba has declared war on the Zika virus, with fumigation squads going house to house to prevent the disease from spreading. CNN's Patrick Oppmann reports.

item.title: Canadians remind America why it's already great
item.description: A creative agency in Toronto asked Canadians to #TellAmericaItsGreat in response to the upcoming U.S. election.

item.title: See shocking encounter with great white shark
item.description: While on a cage diving trip just off the coast of Mexico near Guadalupe Island, one man captured the intense moment when a shark ripped into a cage containing a diver. Click here to watch the full video.

item.title: Limits lifted on Cuban cigars in the US
item.description: Cuba's famed cigars no longer have a $100 import limit in the US. Americans can bring cigars back with them from Cuba for personal use. CNN's Patrick Oppmann takes us to a tobacco plantation on the island.

item.title: Haiti desperate for help after Matthew
item.description: Aid is flying in, but workers are struggling to get it to areas of Haiti that were hardest hit by Hurricane Matthew. CNN's Ivan Watson reports from the town of Jeremie as survivors work to put the community back together.

item.title: Surprise Nobel win
item.description: In a surprise move, the Nobel committee awarded the 2016 Nobel Peace Prize to Colombia's President, Juan Manuel Santos. CNN's Isa Soares reports

item.title: High-end hikes step up adventure
